definition: a hoe/to hoe or dig/to weed/to get rid of
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: I'd like to hoe in the field.
Though it prevents my hoeing them, it is of far more worth than my hoeing.
sentences.chinese: 雖然它使我不能夠地，但比我鋤地更有價值。

sentences.english: Though it prevents my hoeing them, it is of far more worth than my hoeing .
sentences.chinese: 雖然它使我不能夠鋤地，但比我鋤地更有價值。

sentences.english: Though it prevents my hoeing them, it is of far more worth than my hoeing .
sentences.chinese: 雖然它使我不能夠鋤地，但比我鋤地更有價值。

sentences.english: I buckled to my hoeing and the work was done quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我加緊鋤地，很快就鋤好了。

sentences.english: We plowed and hoed till our arms were sore.
sentences.chinese: 我們耕田鋤地直到胳膊痠痛腫大。

sentences.english: Every day he hoes her small flower garden.
sentences.chinese: 他每天都在小花園裏鋤地。

sentences.english: This was not the light in which I hoed them.
sentences.chinese: 但是我在鋤地時對此一無所悟。
